note_tweet.text: This is a story about a brave woman, a lioness. On the morning of October 7, Yulia was already supposed to leave for her home after a night shift at the festival's security. But Yulia decided to stay and save lives. At 7:40 in the morning Yulia sent the first message to her commander: "There are many gunshot wounds here in the area, some managed to escape, some reached us". While the terrorists continued to shoot non-stop, Yulia concentrated on the task she had undertaken, and continued to correspond with her commander to direct forces to the festival grounds. She photographed dead, wounded and sent locations. Half an hour later, Yulia sent her commander a final message: "Pray for me". At 9:14 was the last conversation between the two, he asked her to hide under the bodies and pretend to be dead. She wrote to her husband: "Take care of the children, I love you". 20 minutes later she no longer answered. A trace of her cell phone showed that it was in Gaza. It's a story about the hardworking Yulia, who always took care of her parents and her home. This is a story about Yulia full of love. It is not known what happened to her in her last moments. Her phone is found in the field, burnt, Yulia was brutally murdered and identified thanks to tattoos of hearts with her children's names on her arm. This is a story about Yulia, a police officer, a mother, a fighter, a heroine.

note_tweet.text:
To all my non-Jewish friends who know me well. Please watch this. 

This is what people believe. People who have been brainwashed by those who hate Jews and are simply repeating age-old lies instead of digging a little deeper for the facts. 

I am a Zionist. 
And a proud one. 

And Zionism is this:

The belief that Jews have the right to self-determination in their own country. Just like every other group should. 

That’s it.
That’s the whole story in a few words. 

Nothing more exciting. Sorry to disappoint all the conspiracy theorists and highly-educated street protestors (that’s sarcasm, by the way.)

We are disproportionately more successful than many minorities (only 16 million of us in the world/ 0.2 percent) and we have strong family values and believe in contributing to the societies we live in. 

That’s what we do. 

So I don’t know why we get all the hatred by those we get it from but I think those spreading the lies - those at the root of it all - are envious.

Anyone who would spread such baseless rumors about an entire people are losers. 

Don’t believe a word. 

And. 

Fuck ‘em.

note_tweet.text:
“Hamas terrorist answered my wife’s phone and said: she’s dead! I murdered her! I am Hamas!”

Nati Gonen is hospitalized in Tel Aviv with severe injuries for over 100 days. He was shot in the back trying to escape the Nova peace music festival massacre. “The Palestinian terrorists shot people escaping for their lives. They sprayed bullets and shouted Allahu Akbar!”. 

His wife Shiran was shot but she kept running. Nati couldn’t move but told her to run for their kids, and lost sight of Shiran.

“Shiran was an amazing woman, she was the most loving mother to our three young children, she worked at the post office to make ends meet…I just asked god to give me strength so I will be there for our children.” Nati said.

“To this day I don’t know how she was killed and what did she went through by Hamas before they slaughtered her.”

May Shiran’s memory be a blessing 💔

-Become more openly radical

Maryam explains the history of this coalition. It was formed to get Columbia and Barnard College to commit to BDS measures in 2016. 

When Students for Justice in Palestine and Jewish Voice for Peace were suspended at Columbia, they reformed using CU Apartheid Divest. https://t.co/ECAoJrGP4m

Let's rewind to the beginning though!  

Dylan Kupsh introduces Maryam who is representing 98 student groups that have joined together as CU Apartheid Divest. This group sees Palestine as the vanguard for the collective liberation of humanity. https://t.co/1Yq6By8fXJ

You just met Maryam of CU Apartheid Divest. When she isn't drafting up her coalition's manifesto to avoid material support for terrorism, she is bullying apolitical cultural groups to join her coalition of student groups to protect her and allow for her to be more radical. https://t.co/X43k24H0R8

I attended National Students for Justice In Palestine's event, Want to build a Coalition?, where student leaders shared their tactics. 

Columbia University is up first! 

"With the coalition I underestimated how much support that would provide us to be more radical openly." https://t.co/ae1jaaq3Zb

Must Watch Viewing for those that want to understand the tactics being used on campus by SJP 

How to evade group bans, Spartacus Defense, Bullying groups into "solidarity", and more! https://t.co/QUJEXc0Gqj

note_tweet.text:
One of the 1,391 victims of the October 7 massacre was Hayim Katsman, a professor of philosophy and a D.J with the stage name Dr. 3abass. 
Katsman believed that playing Arabic music would promote understanding between the nations. In his free time, he volunteered to drive Palestinians from Gaza to receive medical treatment in Israel and helped Palestinians farmers near Mount Hebron. Like many of the residents of the Gaze Envelope, he believed that the war was between the governments, not the nations, that men like him would bring peace. He was deceived. 
In many ways, Katsman is a typical victim of this massacre, aimed mostly at the most liberal and leftist communities in Israel, at the people who were the most on Gaza's side. This is the bitter irony of the Simchat Torah massacre.

note_tweet.text:
Tsachi, his hands still covered in his murdered daughter’s blood, is told to get up.

His hands are cuffed behind his back with a cable tie. The children beg the #HamasTerrorists not to take their dad, not to kill him. 

"I love you, don't be a hero, be smart. Take care of yourself, and come back to me in one piece.” Gali screams as the #HamasRapists drag Tsachi away. 

Maayan is buried on October 22. 

There aren't enough seats to hold the hundreds of mourners who arrive to remember her.

Yael and Shachar, at just 11 and 9, have seen such horrors that their small faces crumple into tears again and again. Their sister is dead, and their father isn't here to comfort them.

The mourners wear T-shirts with Tsachi and Maayan's pictures on the front. The words "kidnapped father" and "murdered daughter" appear above their faces, family photos from a happier time. 

On the reverse is a simple and powerful message, "bring Tsachi back".

Over 104 days later, and the nightmare suffered by the Idan family hasn’t ended. 

Tsachi is still a hostage in #Gaza, suffering untold horrors. 

He doesn’t even know if his family is alive. 

His family can’t properly mourn Maayan, because they are fighting to save Tsachi and the other 134 hostages. 

Meanwhile #HamasRapists - and their pro-terror supporters around the world - have celebrated this unimaginable cruelty and barbarism, promising to commit the atrocities of Oct 7 “over and over again.”

This isn’t about Jewish vs Muslim. This isn’t about Israeli vs Palestinian. This fight is about Humanity vs the savage evil of Islamic Jihad. 

Where do you stand? 

End 🧵

#October7Massacre 
#BringThemHomeNow 
#NeverAgainIsNow 
#BelieveIsraeliWomen 
#IStandWithIsrael

note_tweet.text:
The live-stream of the captivity of the Idan family lasted over 26 terrifying minutes. 

“Why are your hands covered in blood?” 11 yo Yael asks her father, finally noticing her father’s arms and hands are red with older sister Maayan’s blood. 

She’s in shock. She still doesn’t understand what’s happening. 

Tsachi only shakes his head sadly, too shocked or horrified to find the words to explain the nightmare they are living. 

“What do they want?” 9 yo Shachar asks between wails of “What happened to Maayan? Is she dead?”

“Don’t look.” Gali tells the children as she pulls Shachar into her lap. 

Maayan’s body is visible from where they are sitting. No more than a few feet from where they are huddled on the ground. 

“Tell Netanyahu don’t shot or we will kill you.” The #HamasTerrorist demands in broken English. 

“Kill?!” Yael exclaims. Shachar starts crying harder. “Please no. No kill.” 

Yael’s only 11, but she’s desperately begging for her life. 3/4

#October7Massacre 
#BringThemHomeNow 
#NeverAgainIsNow 
#BelieveIsraeliWomen 
#IStandWithIsrael

“Come with me!” A terrorist grabs Tomer, taking him out of the Idan home at gunpoint. 

Tomer’s family was also being held captive in their home by #HamasISIS. 

Tomer was ordered to go door-to- door and tell his neighbors and friends in Hebrew it was ‘safe to open the door.’

Whether Israelis opened the door or not didn’t matter.  Either way, the #HamasRapists murdered everyone, family by family, and forced Tomer to witness the slaughter. 

This video is the last time anyone sees Tomer alive. He was murdered by the savages, together with his mother and stepfather.

🧵The Idan family had just celebrated older sister Maayan’s 18th birthday when #HamasTerrorists stormed into their home on Oct 7. 

Balloons and banners were still hanging around the house. 

They heard a loud explosion and before they knew it terrorists were trying to open the door to the safe room where the family was hiding.

Her father Tsachi tried to hold the door shut, but it wasn’t enough. Seeing that the door was cracking open, Maayan bravely jumped up to hold the door with him. 

That’s when Hamas started shooting. 

Maayan was shot in the head, but still alive. Tsachi, in shock, let go of the door to help his daughter. The #HamasISIS savages stormed in. 

The Hamas monsters cruelly didn’t let her family stay with Maayan in her last moments.

They quickly pulled Tsachi, Maayan’s mother Gali, 11 yo sister Yael, and 9 year old brother Shachar out of the room at gunpoint. 

Gali had to step over her Maayan’s body in order to get out of the room. 

Maayan died alone on the cold floor of the safe room. 1/4

11/ The 65 nations in the forum rotate turns taking the chair in alphabetical order. Six states take the chair in a year. Yet a disarmament body should not be headed by the world’s arch-villain on illegal weapons and nuclear proliferation. On March 18, democracies must walk out.

note_tweet.text:
10/ About the Conference of Disarmament:

The Conference of Disarmament (CD) reports to the UN General Assembly and is billed by the UN as “the single multilateral disarmament negotiating forum of the international community.”

Established in 1979 after a special UN General Assembly session, the CD is made up of 65 countries who have been divided in recent years on key issues.

The conference and its predecessors have negotiated such major multilateral arms limitation and disarmament agreements as:

• Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons

• Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production and Stockpiling of Bacteriological (Biological) and Toxin Weapons and on their Destruction

• Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on Their Destruction

• Convention on the Prohibition of Military or Any Other Hostile Use of Environmental Modification Techniques

• Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty

2/ The Iranian regime's presidency will last until May 24th.

The agenda of the Conference contains the following core items: cessation of the nuclear arms race and nuclear disarmament; prevention of nuclear war, including all related matters; prevention of an arms race in outer space; effective international arrangements to assure non-nuclear-weapon States against the use or threat of use of nuclear weapons; new types of weapons of mass destruction and new systems of such weapons, radiological weapons; comprehensive programme of disarmament; and transparency in armaments.

I attended National Students for Justice In Palestine's event, Want to build a Coalition?, where student leaders shared their tactics. 

Columbia University is up first! 

"With the coalition I underestimated how much support that would provide us to be more radical openly." https://t.co/ae1jaaq3Zb

Lastly, Maryam explains that the first groups to join her coalition were the far-left groups. However, her advice is "militant outreach" because support can be found in all sorts of places. https://t.co/xSayqoSiJ5
Maryam explains that the Coalition is to make doxing meaningless. You can't dox everyone and if you do get doxed, then the Palestinian Alumni Association will give you a job. https://t.co/yt3wpVPsSO

Maryam explains some of the committees that the coalition has formed: Direction Action, Strategy, Legal, and Security. 

Palestine Legal and Columbia Law Students for Palestine are providing legal support.

Who is their Security Team? Is this an outside group or their militia? https://t.co/YKPqvdK8dw

Maryam advises other student activists to...

-Have an aggressive outreach approach
-Get Massive Groups like Student Workers Assoc. to prevent Doxing
-Become more openly radical
-Avoid "Normalizers" 
-Focus on Collective Liberation https://t.co/SjHC9qjY4n

Maryam admits that the students at Columbia really didn't know much about Israel and Palestine. She blames the Zionists on campus for galvanizing the student body. 

The public responses of Columbia Alumni, AOC, and Within Our Lifetime acted as fuel to the fire. https://t.co/PrsYFJjG4U

note_tweet.text:
After tearing the Idan family away from their daughter Maayan, who lay dying in the safe room, #HamasTerrorists demanded Gali’s log onto Facebook on her phone to livestream their crimes. 

On the livestream, multiple Hamas terrorists armed with AK-47 rifles and grenades surround the family. 

With them is another hostage, Tomer Eliaz, the Idan’s 17 year old neighbor. 

“Come with me!” A terrorist grabs Tomer, taking him out of the Idan home at gunpoint. 

Tomer’s family was also being held captive in their home by #HamasISIS. 

Tomer was ordered to go door-to- door and tell his neighbors and friends in Hebrew it was ‘safe to open the door.’

Whether Israelis opened the door or not didn’t matter.  Either way, the #HamasRapists murdered everyone, family by family, and forced Tomer to witness the slaughter. 

This video is the last time anyone sees Tomer alive. He was murdered by the savages, together with his mother and stepfather. 

His step sisters Dafna Elyakim, 15, and Ella Elyakim, 8, were among the 240 hostages kidnapped to #Gaza.

note_tweet.text:
🧵The Idan family had just celebrated older sister Maayan’s 18th birthday when #HamasTerrorists stormed into their home on Oct 7. 

Balloons and banners were still hanging around the house. 

They heard a loud explosion and before they knew it terrorists were trying to open the door to the safe room where the family was hiding.

Her father Tsachi tried to hold the door shut, but it wasn’t enough. Seeing that the door was cracking open, Maayan bravely jumped up to hold the door with him. 

That’s when Hamas started shooting. 

Maayan was shot in the head, but still alive. Tsachi, in shock, let go of the door to help his daughter. The #HamasISIS savages stormed in. 

The Hamas monsters cruelly didn’t let her family stay with Maayan in her last moments.

They quickly pulled Tsachi, Maayan’s mother Gali, 11 yo sister Yael, and 9 year old brother Shachar out of the room at gunpoint. 

Gali had to step over her Maayan’s body in order to get out of the room. 

Maayan died alone on the cold floor of the safe room. 1/4

note_tweet.text:
10/ About the Conference of Disarmament:

The Conference of Disarmament (CD) reports to the UN General Assembly and is billed by the UN as “the single multilateral disarmament negotiating forum of the international community.”

Established in 1979 after a special UN General Assembly session, the CD is made up of 65 countries who have been divided in recent years on key issues.

The conference and its predecessors have negotiated such major multilateral arms limitation and disarmament agreements as:

• Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons

• Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production and Stockpiling of Bacteriological (Biological) and Toxin Weapons and on their Destruction

• Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on Their Destruction

• Convention on the Prohibition of Military or Any Other Hostile Use of Environmental Modification Techniques

• Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty

note_tweet.text:
2/ The Iranian regime's presidency will last until May 24th.

The agenda of the Conference contains the following core items: cessation of the nuclear arms race and nuclear disarmament; prevention of nuclear war, including all related matters; prevention of an arms race in outer space; effective international arrangements to assure non-nuclear-weapon States against the use or threat of use of nuclear weapons; new types of weapons of mass destruction and new systems of such weapons, radiological weapons; comprehensive programme of disarmament; and transparency in armaments.
